verses.roman:
sa taṁ niśāmyātta-rathāṅgam agrato
vyavasthitaṁ padma-palāśa-locanam
vilokya cāmarṣa-pariplutendriyo
ruṣā sva-danta-cchadam ādaśac chvasan

synonyms: saḥ—that demon; tam—the Supreme Personality of Godhead; niśāmya—after seeing; ātta-rathāṅgam—armed with the Sudarśana disc; agrataḥ—before him; vyavasthitam—standing in position; padma—lotus flower; palāśa—petals; locanam—eyes; vilokya—after seeing; ca—and; amarṣa—by indignation; paripluta—overpowered; indriyaḥ—his senses; ruṣā—with great resentment; sva-danta-chadam—his own lip; ādaśat—bit; śvasan—hissing.
translation: When the demon saw the Personality of Godhead, who had eyes just like lotus petals, standing in position before him, armed with His Sudarśana discus, his senses were overpowered by indignation. He began to hiss like a serpent, and he bit his lip in great resentment.
